title: clean.request
description: Request to clean or sanitize content (normalize, redact, strip noise) with explicit limits and context.

x402.description: x402 envelope describing the verb, version, and routing metadata for this request.

trace.description: Trace metadata for correlating this request with downstream spans and receipts.

actor.description: Identity of the logical initiator of this request (human, app, or agent).

channel.description: How this request is being transported and invoked.

endpoint.description: Optional endpoint or address for this channel (e.g., URL, topic, queue name).

modalities.description: Modalities involved in this request (e.g., text, markdown, html).

auth.description: Authentication or authorization context for the request.

token_hint.description: Optional opaque hint or truncated token for audit/debug. Do not store secrets here.

actor_wallet.description: Optional EVM wallet address used for auth.

limits.description: Execution and output limits for this cleaning request.

max_chars.description: Maximum characters allowed in the cleaned content.

max_cost.description: Optional maximum cost budget in abstract units (e.g., credits, USD cents).

timeout_ms.description: Timeout for this request in milliseconds.

input.description: Primary content to clean or sanitize.

content.description: Raw text or markup to be cleaned.

locale.description: IETF BCP 47 language tag for the input content.

policy.description: Cleaning policy describing what should be removed or normalized.

redact_pii.description: Whether to attempt to redact sensitive personal information.

normalize_whitespace.description: Whether to normalize whitespace and line breaks.

lowercase.description: Whether to transform content to lowercase.

metadata.description: Optional additional metadata for routing, billing, or analytics. Safe to log.
